segment.source: Update Windows Store for Business account settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Update Windows Store for Business account settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: The Account information page in Windows Store for Business shows information about your organization that you can update, including country or region, organization name, default domain, and language preference.
segment.target: The Account information page in Windows Store for Business shows information about your organization that you can update, including country or region, organization name, default domain, and language preference.

segment.source: Update Windows Store for Business account settings
segment.target: Update Windows Store for Business account settings

segment.source: The Account information page in Windows Store for Business allows you to manage organization information, payment options, and offline licensing settings.
segment.target: The Account information page in Windows Store for Business allows you to manage organization information, payment options, and offline licensing settings.

segment.source: The organization information and payment options are required before you can acquire apps that have a price.
segment.target: The organization information and payment options are required before you can acquire apps that have a price.

segment.source: We’ll need your business address, email contact, and tax-exemption certificates that apply to your country or locale.
segment.target: We’ll need your business address, email contact, and tax-exemption certificates that apply to your country or locale.

segment.source: Before purchasing apps that have a fee, you need to add or update your organization's business address, and contact email address .
segment.target: Before purchasing apps that have a fee, you need to add or update your organization's business address, and contact email address .

segment.source: We use the Business address to calculate sales tax.
segment.target: We use the Business address to calculate sales tax.

segment.source: If your organization's address has already been entered for other commercial purchases through the Microsoft Store, or through other online purchases such as Office 365 or Azure subscriptions, then we’ll use the same address in the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: If your organization's address has already been entered for other commercial purchases through the Microsoft Store, or through other online purchases such as Office 365 or Azure subscriptions, then we’ll use the same address in the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: If we don’t have an address,we’ll ask you to enter it during your first purchase.
segment.target: If we don’t have an address,we’ll ask you to enter it during your first purchase.

segment.source: We need an email address in case we need to contact you about your Store for Business account.
segment.target: We need an email address in case we need to contact you about your Store for Business account.

segment.source: This email account should reach the admin for your organization’s O365 or Azure AD tenant that is used with Store for Business.
segment.target: This email account should reach the admin for your organization’s O365 or Azure AD tenant that is used with Store for Business.

segment.source: To update Organization information, click Edit organization information.
segment.target: To update Organization information, click Edit organization information.

segment.source: Taxes for Windows Store for Business purchases are determined by your business address.
segment.target: Taxes for Windows Store for Business purchases are determined by your business address.

segment.source: Businesses in these countries can provide their VAT number or local equivalent:
segment.target: Businesses in these countries can provide their VAT number or local equivalent:

segment.source: These countries can provide their VAT number or local equivalent in Account information.
segment.target: These countries can provide their VAT number or local equivalent in Account information.

segment.source: However, they can only acquire free apps.
segment.target: However, they can only acquire free apps.

segment.source: If you qualify for tax-exempt status in your market, start a service request to establish tax exempt status for your organization.
segment.target: If you qualify for tax-exempt status in your market, start a service request to establish tax exempt status for your organization.

segment.source: Sign in to the Store for Business.
segment.target: Sign in to the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Support, and then under Store or account support click Start a service request.
segment.target: Click Support, and then under Store or account support click Start a service request.

segment.source: Certificate of Exemption (or equivalent letter of authorization)
segment.target: Certificate of Exemption (or equivalent letter of authorization)

segment.source: International organizations that hold tax exaemption
segment.target: International organizations that hold tax exaemption

segment.source: Certification / letter confirmation from local tax authorities
segment.target: Certification / letter confirmation from local tax authorities

segment.source: Sales taxes are calculated against the unit price, and then aggregated.
segment.target: Sales taxes are calculated against the unit price, and then aggregated.

segment.source: (unit price X tax rate) X quantity = total sales tax
segment.target: (unit price X tax rate) X quantity = total sales tax

segment.source: You can purchase apps from the Windows Store for Business using your credit card.
segment.target: You can purchase apps from the Windows Store for Business using your credit card.

segment.source: You can enter your credit card information on Account Information, or when you purchase an app.
segment.target: You can enter your credit card information on Account Information, or when you purchase an app.

segment.source: We currently accept these credit cards:
segment.target: We currently accept these credit cards:

segment.source: Not all cards available in all countries.
segment.target: Not all cards available in all countries.

segment.source: When you add a payment option, Store for Business shows which cards are available in your region.
segment.target: When you add a payment option, Store for Business shows which cards are available in your region.

segment.source: To add a new payment option
segment.target: To add a new payment option

segment.source: Click Settings, and then click Account information.
segment.target: Click Settings, and then click Account information.

segment.source: Under My payment options, tap or clickShow my payment options, and then select the type of credit card that you want to add.
segment.target: Under My payment options, tap or clickShow my payment options, and then select the type of credit card that you want to add.

segment.source: Add information to any required fields, and then clickNext.
segment.target: Add information to any required fields, and then clickNext.

segment.source: Once you click Next, the information you provided will be validated with a test authorization transaction and, if validated, the payment option will be added to your list of available payment options.
segment.target: Once you click Next, the information you provided will be validated with a test authorization transaction and, if validated, the payment option will be added to your list of available payment options.

segment.source: Otherwise, you will be prompted for additional information or notified if there are any problems.
segment.target: Otherwise, you will be prompted for additional information or notified if there are any problems.

segment.source: When adding credit or debit cards, you may be prompted to enter a CVV .
segment.target: When adding credit or debit cards, you may be prompted to enter a CVV .

segment.source: The CVV is only used for verification purposes and is not stored in our systems after validation.
segment.target: The CVV is only used for verification purposes and is not stored in our systems after validation.

segment.source: Click Settings, and then click Account information.
segment.target: Click Settings, and then click Account information.

segment.source: Under My payment options > Credit Cards, select the payment option that you want to update, and then click Update.
segment.target: Under My payment options > Credit Cards, select the payment option that you want to update, and then click Update.

segment.source: Enter any updated information in the appropriate fields, and then click Next.
segment.target: Enter any updated information in the appropriate fields, and then click Next.

segment.source: Once you click Next, the information you provided will be validated with a test authorization transaction and, if validated, the payment option will be added to your list of available payment options.
segment.target: Once you click Next, the information you provided will be validated with a test authorization transaction and, if validated, the payment option will be added to your list of available payment options.

segment.source: Otherwise, you will be prompted for additional information or notified if there are any problems.
segment.target: Otherwise, you will be prompted for additional information or notified if there are any problems.

segment.source: Certain actions, like updating or adding a payment option, require temporary “test authorization” transactions to validate the payment option.
segment.target: Certain actions, like updating or adding a payment option, require temporary “test authorization” transactions to validate the payment option.

segment.source: These may appear on your statement as $0.00 authorizations or as small pending transactions.
segment.target: These may appear on your statement as $0.00 authorizations or as small pending transactions.

segment.source: These transactions are temporary and should not impact your account unless you make several changes in a short period of time or have a low balance.
segment.target: These transactions are temporary and should not impact your account unless you make several changes in a short period of time or have a low balance.

segment.source: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.
segment.target: Offline licensing is a new licensing option for Windows 10.

segment.source: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.
segment.target: With offline licenses, organizations can cache apps and their licenses to deploy within their network.

segment.source: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.
segment.target: ISVs or devs can opt-in their apps for offline licensing when they submit them to the developer center.

segment.source: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in Store for Business.
segment.target: Only apps that are opted in to offline licensing will show that they are available for offline licensing in Store for Business.

segment.source: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.
segment.target: This model means organizations can deploy apps when users or devices do not have connectivity to the Store.

segment.source: You have the following distribution options for offline-licensed apps:
segment.target: You have the following distribution options for offline-licensed apps:

segment.source: Include the app in a provisioning package, and then use it as part of imaging a device.
segment.target: Include the app in a provisioning package, and then use it as part of imaging a device.

segment.source: Distribute the app through a management tool.
segment.target: Distribute the app through a management tool.

segment.source: For more information, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Store for Business.
segment.target: For more information, see Distribute apps to your employees from the Store for Business.
